packageMetadata.name: External-Identifier
packageMetadata.helpText: Sender-provided Identifier of the package. There should be a one-to-one mapping between the External-Identifier and the Bag-Group-Identifier.

packageMetadata.name: External-Description
packageMetadata.helpText: Description of A brief explanation of the contents and provenance.

packageMetadata.name: Internal-Sender-Identifier
packageMetadata.helpText: An alternate sender-specific identifier for the content and/or bag.

packageMetadata.name: Internal-Sender-Description
packageMetadata.helpText: A sender-local prose description of the contents of the bag.

packageMetadata.name: Bag-Count
packageMetadata.helpText: Sequence number of a given bag within a bag group. The format is "<n> of <m>", where <n> is the sequence number within the group and <m> is the total number of bags in the group. If the latter is not known, the value of <m> should be '?'. "Bag-Count: 1 of 1" should be specified if the entire package will be captured in a single bag. This mechanism allows a package to be split across multiple bags.

packageMetadata.name: Bag-Group-Identifier
packageMetadata.helpText: A sender-provided identifier for a bag group. For DCS packages, the bag group identifier should uniquely identify a package and when combined with the sequence number ('<n>') from the Bag-Count should uniquely identify a bag.

packageMetadata.name: Bag-Size
packageMetadata.helpText: The size or approximate size of the bag, intended primarily for human consumption.

packageMetadata.name: Payload-Oxum
packageMetadata.helpText: The "octetstream sum" of the payload directory, in the format "<octetcount>.<streamcount>" (number-of-bytes.number-of-files).
